p: C.albicans, whose overall prevalence was lower than G.vaginalis, was not associated with symptoms and was mostly observed among women aged between 30 and 39â€‰years (50%). Candida species may persist for months, years and live in symbiosis with vaginal microbiota without causing any symptoms [ 31, 32]. However, acute vulvovaginal candidiasis can occur following colonization when there is breakdown in the symbiosis, which triggers the overgrowth of C andida or alteration in the protective defense mechanisms [ 33, 34].
